result.execSummary:
The defendant Max A. Taylor-Hayden was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Maintain full time employment, schooling or combination of at least 30 hours per week.  If not, must perform 10 hours of community service per week.

Absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol except for prescriptions taken as prescribed and with prior agent authorization.  

No possession of alcohol or controlled substances.

205 days jail credit if defendant is revoked.  

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by Department.  

DNA sample.  

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Max A. Taylor-Hayden

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 1:16 pm 
INCLUDES 14CF485, 14CF760, AND 15CF8. 
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo; Deft appears in person with Atty Rick Cveykus. 
State notes history of matter. Atty Cveykus notes def has been sentenced already in the SAR but still needs to be sentenced on the DEOJ revocation in 14CF485 and sentenced in 14CF760 and 15CF8. 
Atty Cveykus notes corrections to PSI. 
State notes agreement of the parties re: sentencing. 
Atty Cveykus makes statement. Deft makes statement. 
COURT makes findings. 

COURT ORDERS: 
In 14CF485: Ct. 1>>SWH for 2 years probation - CONDITIONS: assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; maintain fulltime employment/schooling/combination of the 2 of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 10 hours of community service per week; absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol except for prescriptions taken as prescribed and with prior agent authorization; no possession of alcohol or controlled substances; AODA; DNA sample and surcharge; payment of court costs. 
In 14CF760: Ct. 2>>30 days MCJ with 30 days credit and court costs. 
In 15CF8: Ct. 1>>SWH for 2 years probation - CONDITIONS: 205 days MCJ with 205 days credit; assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; maintain fulltime employment/schooling/combination of the 2 of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 10 hours of community service per week; absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol except for prescriptions taken as prescribed and with prior agent authorization; no possession of alcohol or controlled substances; AODA; DNA sample and surcharge; payment of court costs including $60 of buy money to Wausau PD. 
COURT finds the deft is entitled to 205 days jail credit in 14CF485 and 15CF8 if revoked. 
COURT ORDERS all sentences to run concurrent. 

COURT allows counsel to keep copies of PSI and advises them to maintain its confidentiality. 
Adj: 1:31 pm
Sentencing hearing on revocation on June 22, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
for substitution of attorneys - Rick Cveykus to be attorney of record (includes 14CF485, 760, filed in 15CF8)
w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief (includes 14CF485, 760, filed in 15CF8)

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 9:46 am 
INCLUDES 14CF485, 14CF760, AND 15CF8. 
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo; Def appears in person, in custody with Atty Paul Goetz. 

WAIVER OF PRELIM IN 15CF8. 
Waiver of Prelim. filed. 
Court questions deft as to waiver. 
Court finds waiver freely and voluntarily made. 
COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial. 
Information filed. Reading Waived. 

MOTION FOR ENTRY OF JUDGMENT IN 14CF485. 
State moves to enter judgment on Ct. 1 (Possess with Intent THC). 
COURT grants and enters judgment on Ct. 1. 

PLEA HEARING IN 14CF760 AND 15CF8.   
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.
State moves to:
In 14CF760: Ct. 1 (Felony Bail Jumping/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
In 15CF8: Ct. 2 (Felony Bail Jumping/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 
PLEA: 
In 14CF760: Ct. 2 (Possession of Controlled Substance/Repeater)>>GUILTY. 
In 15CF8: Ct. 1 (Manufacture/Deliver THC)>>GUILTY. 
COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 

COURT ORDERS: PSI on all 3 files to be completed within 6 weeks. 
Sentencing set for 4/27/2015 at 9:15 am in Br. 3. 

SENTENCING AFTER REVOCATION IN 14CF485. 
COURT ORDERS on Cts. 3 & 4>>30 days MCJ on each to run concurrent with 30 days credit for time served and court costs. 

Bond Continues - COURT advises def to abide by absolute sobreity bond conditions.  
Adj: 10:16 am
Sentencing hearing on April 27, 2015 at 09:15 am.
Preliminary Hearing on January 30, 2015 at 09:45 am.
Absolute sobriety. Contact Attic Correctional Services at 715-848-3202 for Day report.
